item.description:
Story Slam, Season IV in Fall 2012!


Theme: Rock&Roll

Blaow!! Ever find yourself on your favorite band’s tour bus, rollin’ with the best of ‘em?  Ever moshed and lived to tell the tale?  Ever wept like a baby at a show?  Tell us the story!

 

Admission: $10 / $5 for members&students

Buy Tickets Here.


Emcee: Scott Schultz has interviewed and photographed hundreds of bands for the Los Angeles based indie rock magazine, LA Record.  Scott became involved with storytelling in December, 2011, winning his first slam and competing in the Big MouthOff at Coolidge Corner Theater. In March, he was named Massmouth’s Emerging Storyteller. Scott's stories have been heard on NYC-based Yarn AudioWorks and NPR’s O’Dark 30


What is a Story Slam? A story slam is a contest of stories by known and undiscovered talent. Themes are posted on our events pages (www.massmouth.com) and story slammers sign up on the night to tell a 5-minute short story on the evening's theme. Ten names will be drawn at random from a box. A team of 5 volunteer judges - interested amateurs, storytellers, theater people and members of the audience who love stories - evaluate how well each story is told, how well it is constructed, how well the story explores, connects and/or reveals some truth about the theme and, how well it honors the time limit. The 2 highest-scoring tellers are awarded prizes and an opportunity to perform at the "BigMouthOff" at the at the end of the slam season (Sept  - April).

For more info, visit: http://massmouth.ning.com/forum/topics/story-slam-rules-pr-what-is


Venues:


CLUB PASSIM
Street: 47 Palmer Street
City/Town: Cambridge, MA
Website or Map: http://www.clubpassim.org

Club Passim dates are MONDAYS 6:30-9pm:
SEP 17
OCT 15
NOV 19
DEC 17
JAN 21, 2013
FEB 18, 2013
MAR 18, 2013
Admisson $10 or $5 for students and Passim members.
Tickets in advance are recommended.


Go to Club Passim's website to buy tickets!!
http://tickets.passim.org/


Passim, a nonprofit arts organization, creates an interactive and inspiring music experience for all, building a vibrant community for artists, students and audience members through its legendary listening venue and school of music.


Directions:  Via the T
Take Red Line to Harvard Square T stop.
Meters are in force to 8:00 PM. On-street parking at meters can often be found along Brattle Street and Cambridge Common. Resident only parking is enforced.

DOYLE'S CAFE
Street: 3484 Washington Street
City/Town: JP 02130

Doyle’s date are SUNDAYS, 6:30-9pm: 
SEP 9
OCT 14
NOV 11
DEC 9
JAN 13, 2013
FEB 10, 2013
MAR 10, 2013

Admission: $8.00 in advance $10.00 at the door.

Tickets in advance are recommended.

Buy your tickets here:
http://massmouthjp.eventbrite.com


Regulary recognized as Boston's best bar and restaurant, Doyle's offers and unmatched mix of good food, good talk and good people.


Doyle's is host to one of New England's largest selections of draft beer.  The mahogany bar dates back over 125 years to 1882.


Doyle's is located in the Jamaica Plain neighborhood of Boston, accessible by the Orange line and close to the Sam Adams Brewery!
Nearest transit: Green Street (Orange Line)

 

• Like us on Facebook @ https://www.facebook.com/massmouth.org

• Follow us on Twitter @massmouth
